intro: Rhynchospora cephalophora, commonly known as the hooded spike-rush, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, spike-like inflorescence that is often covered with a hood-like structure, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes and bogs. It has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers. Rhynchospora cephalophora is often found in temperate regions and plays a role in maintaining wetland ecosystems.
